This leads us to an important question:
How can we explore the world today while
ensuring it remains just as captivating for
generations to come?
Many of us love immersing ourselves in nature
and creating unforgettable memories, yet we
also feel a growing responsibility to protect
these cherished spaces. Here’s how to make your
next holiday more eco-friendly without
sacrificing adventure or enjoyment.
Consider a staycation
Not every holiday needs to involve long-haul
flights or far-flung destinations. A staycation is a
simple, sustainable way to recharge while
reducing your carbon footprint.
Explore hidden gems in your local area — a
scenic park, a quirky café, or a fascinating
museum could be just around the corner. If
you’re craving a bit more adventure, a short
drive to a nearby beach, forest, or nature
reserve offers a refreshing escape.

Discovering local treasures not only supports

Ditch the disposables
One of the joys of travelling is exploring local
markets and collecting unique souvenirs. Make
your trip greener by carrying a reusable tote
bag — sturdier, easier to carry, and far better for
the environment than flimsy plastic.
Don’t forget a refillable water bottle or coffee
cup. Staying hydrated or enjoying your favourite
drinks on the go doesn’t have to come at the
planet’s expense.
Around 1 million plastic bottles are bought every
minute worldwide. That’s over 400 million
tonnes of plastic each year, half of it single-use,
with less than 10% ever recycled, according to
the 2025 United Nations Environment
Programme (UNEP) report.
Choosing reusables while travelling is one of the
simplest ways to cut down on this mounting
waste.
Choose eco-friendly
accommodations
Where you stay can shape your travel
experience and environmental impact. Look for
eco-conscious hotels with green certifications or
those powered by renewable energy. Many of
these accommodations implement initiatives
such as recycling programmes, water-saving
fixtures, and locally sourced amenities.

Even if eco-friendly options are limited, small
actions make a difference: turn off taps while
brushing your teeth, take shorter showers, and
switch off lights when leaving your room.
Individually, these habits seem minor, but
collectively, they conserve valuable resources.

Leave no trace
Adopt the “Leave No Trace” principle wherever
you go. Always clean up after yourself and,
when possible, pick up litter along the way —
whether you’re in a park, on a beach, or hiking a
trail.
Carrying a small trash bag can make it easier to
manage waste responsibly. These simple actions
help preserve natural beauty for future visitors,
ensuring these spaces remain pristine for years
to come.
Read also: How To Be Smart With Your Money
During The Festive Season
Travel is about more than just destinations — it’s
also about the choices you make along the way.
By considering sustainability in your plans, you
can enjoy unforgettable experiences while
protecting the planet.
During the holiday season, travel thoughtfully,
explore mindfully, and leave the world better
than you found it.
